tutorial: You were seen in the Emergency Department today for abdominal pain.
Your evaluation, including CT scan of your abdomen, as well as blood and urine tests, indicated no emergency requiring hospitalization today.
Your symptoms improved with medication in the ER.
We have prescribed you a medication called Pepcid (famotidine) to take daily to help with your abdominal pain.
Please follow-up with your primary care doctor in the next 1-2 weeks.
Please return to the Emergency Department if you experience worsening pain, vomiting, fevers, or other symptoms concerning to you.
It was a pleasure caring for you today.
chest pain: You were seen in the Emergency Department today for chest pain.
Your evaluation, including EKG and blood testing of your heart enzymes, indicated no heart attack or other emergency requiring hospitalization today.
Your pain improved with observation in the ER.
Please follow-up with your primary care doctor in the next 1-2 weeks.
At that time, please discuss your ER visit today.
You should ask your primary care doctor about whether you should obtain a cardiac stress test to assess your heart function.
Please return to the Emergency Department if you experience worsening pain, shortness of breath, fevers, or other symptoms concerning to you.
It was a pleasure caring for you today.
belly pain: You were seen in the emergency room for your belly pain.
We did an ultrasound which showed stones in your gallbladder.
These are very common and can often cause the type of belly pain you experienced.
We did blood work which did not show signs of infection.
The surgery team saw you and recommended you follow up with them, they will call you to schedule an appointment for further management.
Please return to the emergency department if you develop fevers, chills, vomiting, or any other symptoms concerning to you.
back pain: You were seen in the emergency room for your back pain.
We did tests which did not show us the cause of your pain as something emergent.
We suspect you have a herniated disc.
For pain, please take tylenol 1000mg every 8 hours as needed as well as 400mg ibuprofen or advil every 8 hours as needed.
Please schedule an appointment for follow-up with your primary care physician this week for further evaluation of your symptoms.

Please return to the Emergency Department if you experience worsening back pain, difficulty walking, fevers, numbness, tingling, inability to control your bowel or bladder, or any other concerning symptoms.
